subject: Re: [junit] Re: mocking 3rd party classes?
msgSnippet: OK.. thank you all... I ve decided to go for the yelling :-) ... From: J. B. Rainsberger To: junit@yahoogroups.com Sent: Thursday, August 04, 2005 6:15 PM
messageBody:
OK.. thank you all...

I've decided to go for the yelling :-)


----- Original Message -----
From: J. B. Rainsberger
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, August 04, 2005 6:15 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] Re: mocking 3rd party classes?


Bob Koss wrote:
>
> >
> > I am working wiht a 3rd party api. Where I have to extend one
> > of their clases and Inteact via a receiveAsyncMessage(Message) method.
> >
> > The Message class ha no default or public constructor.
> >
> > class Message extends EventObject {
> > protected final String type;
> > /**
> > * some more properties
> > */
> > Message(String type,....){
> >
> > }
> >
> > }
> >
> > How can I mock this class?
> >
> > I want to be able to create fake messages to test my code
> > without having to run the server and the client application.
>
>
> Can you inherit from Message?
>
> class TestableMessage extends Message {
> public TestableMessage() {
> super(null);
> }
> }

Ignore my previous response. Bob's is much better, by virtue of being
(1) helpful and (2) correct. Mine was neither. I need more coffee.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
